Posts.Content:
Yes I heard that too. Thats great they are sending you for an MRI hopefully you can get to the bottom of it. I thought since they can see it, they can biopsy it...
Do you have any family history of BC?

Posts.Title: Painless lump. Doctor doesn't know what it is.

Posts.Content:
OMG I getting all upset hearing this stuff. I swear I have experienced first hand malpractice and I learned from everything in my experience that you have to be your own advocate because no one cares about
 you more then YOU. Seek answers. If you have a lump/lymph node make sure you figure out what it is, even go to a hometown breast surgeon who can give you more personalized care (sometimes the reputable places are just factories and only concern themselves with very rare cases to advance their research)...
Try not to worry abotu the radiation I got hung up on that stuff too months ago, but there is nothing you can do... all you can do to try to offset it to some degree is eat well, limit alcohol and try to exercise. I have managed to only do 1 of these 3. lol ITS HARD!
Posts.Title: Multiple/excessive films for no reason

Posts.Content:
Thank you so much Sherbear for your reply........
I had the ultrasound today and it was negative. They couldnt find the lump that my doctor felt, which today he told me it was pea sized and if the ultrasound was negative not to worry about
 it. But now I am even more stressed because I would like to know what the lump is.. What sparked me to go to the doctor is that I have been having itchy and pain in my left breast and that is where he found the lump. 
I was thinking of making an appointment with a breast surgeon. I dont know, I think my family is annoyed with me and telling me if the doctor said let it go, let it go.
Posts.Title: please help me I am scared to death!!! i dont know what to do!

Posts.Content:
Thanks Sherbear,
Being the anxious person that I am, I could not let it go. I had a repeat ultrasound (and I guess the first tech missed it) because the second tech was so thorough and found it right away. It is 8mm and the radiologist was VERy confident it was a fibroidadenoma. He still told me to come in 6 months to make sure it doesnt get bigger, which he followed by saying it wouldn't...
I keep reading ladies on forums who were told they had such a thing and the radiologist ended up being wrong. I just want it out... I think I am going ot make an appointment with a breast surgeon..
Posts.Title: please help me I am scared to death!!! i dont know what to do!

Posts.Content:
Good Morning Everyone,
4 months ago I had an ultrasound on a lump which turned out to be a fibroidadenoma. First ever ultrasound on my breast I am 34 years old. I had to go for a follow up to make sure it didn't grow, I made the appointment before the 6 month mark just to relieve my anxiety about
 the whole thing. The ultrasound tech but the probe only on the spot near the fibroiadenoma and although that lump remained the same, I had another growth a 1.2cm nodule. Long story short after sleepless nights and reading up all about
 breast cancer and pregnancy (I am 21 weeks pregnant) I had a biopsy and thankgod it was benign but the diagnosis was PASH.
I am so scared, I know its benign but everything I read online says it should be removed and I got the old follow up in 6 months. Also what scares me too is that she literally put the probe on a PART OF MY BREAST and found this then imagine what she would have found had she scanned my entire breast. I begged the surgeon to write me a script
 for a bilateral breast ultrasound but she said she doesnt want to 
open a can of worms?? and its not for screening! I don't know what to do now and I cant find anything to relieve my anxiety, thoughts?
Posts.Title: Anyone have experience with PASH/Stromal Fibrosis

Posts.Content:
Hello I hope any of you can help me I AM SO SCARED. I had a breast ultrasound done 4 months ago on a tiny lump which after biopsy was determined it was a fibroidadenoma. The doctor told me to come back in 6 months for a follow up ultrasound just to determine stability. I am 5 months pregnant now and I went back today (4 months later) for the follow up ultrasound and the doctor told me that the tiny fibroid has not changed in size but that my breast has changed so much (its like a new breast) and I have clusters of masses that he can't tell if its hormonal from the pregnancy or something else so he wants to do another biopsy of the entire area. I am really worried this could be BC. Could it be possible in 4 months that cancer can proliferate like this?
Also I have had three doctors check my breasts every single month during pregnancy and no one found anything particularly worrisome in my breast. I am so scared.
Posts.Title: 5 months pregnant and ultrasound found clusters of masses in breast going for biopsy SO SCARED.

Posts.Content:
So a little update on my breast biopsy it came back negative, but stromal fibrosis? Everything I read about
 it sounds like yes it's benign but people tend to get the removed. My doctor just told me follow up ultrasound in 6 months. I don't know what to do now. Anyone have any idea?
Posts.Title: 5 months pregnant and ultrasound found clusters of masses in breast going for biopsy SO SCARED.

Posts.Content:
Thank you so much for responding. I was very active on the prostate cancer forum too when my dad was diagnosed in 2009. It is a very active forum and the men there are so kind and considerate. I wish we had something like that here.
Thankfully my biopsy came back okay. I am still having shooting pain and zingers in that area. I still don't feel good, always scared in the back of my mind they missed something.
I am SO Sorry to hear about
 your friend, that is just heartbreaking. How is she doing? and how are you? I hope everything works out for the best and I truly hope the radiologist was wrong in this case. Please keep me updated. Hugs xx
Posts.Title: PlS I need some support and resassurance before my biopsy today

Posts.Content:
Thank you Sherry. I am really worried I have an ultrasound tomorrow. I am so scared I keep getting the worst thoughts in my mind. 
I did ask my doctor when he discovered the lump if it was cancer? And she laughed and said NO. How can he be so confident? Is it only because I am 33, well I know a handful of 30 year olds who had BC. OMG. My anxiety is through the roof.
Posts.Title: please help me I am scared to death!!! i dont know what to do!

Posts.Content:
Thank you so much for responding to me! Can I ask you mine is 8mm, I dont know is that considered relatively average size, small or medium? Also, how did the lumpectomy go? I want to take it out because I am an overly anxious person and the idea of having to wait size months to see if it grows scares the heck out of me...
Also, can I ask you did you ever get shooting pain from them, I feel like mine is causing that. The pain seemed to have started a month ago, I am scared because they told me I could have had this for years, but if I did does that mean it it is rapidly growing since it only started causing me pain now? 
Thank you for getting back to me it is so nice to have someone to talk to.
Posts.Title: please help me I am scared to death!!! i dont know what to do!

Posts.Content: Hi I am 34 too. I think some areas of your breast just tend to be more dense then others. I hope your mamo went well.
Posts.Title: what causes them to harden?

Posts.Content:
I am sorry to hear what you are going through Djry11. It is so frustrating... When I had the second ultrasound (first one tech lady didn't find anything she only scanned half of my breast), after the script
 said entire breast, I had to do another one, they did entire breast and found the lump...thankfully, but I had to fight with my insurance and it was't my fault that they messed up the first one. 
I would still argue with PCP for a breast MRI... I don't know I am sorry to hear what you are going through it is like pulling teeth, you are right. It's sad because look at you, you are aggressive and they won't let you get as far as you should. Imagine the other people who slip between the cracks. NO one cares...
I hope it works well for you and good luck with the heart surgery...it will all pass and sunshine is just around the corner (that is how I like to think)
I had the biopsy, it was honestly a piece of cake, although they give you nothing to cover your eyes so I turned away since I did not want to watch them cut a piece of my breast lol...
Posts.Title: Painless lump. Doctor doesn't know what it is.

Posts.Content: I am sorry that happened. I don't think I can offer much in terms of advice but I would be just as upset as you with all that extra radiation and no answer... Why don't you take those films and go to a trusted breast surgeon and have her look at them,,maybe she can biopsy the lymph node for a piece of mind.. That is what I would do..
Posts.Title: Multiple/excessive films for no reason

Posts.Content:
Please help me for about
 three months on and off i have been having itchiness in my left breast area mainly my nipple.
I went to the OBGYN and he found a lump on the top of my nipple. He said he is not concerned at all and send me for a mammogram, which I am waiting to do. 
I AM SCARED TO DEATH i have a 20 month old daughter and I feel the world crashing down. I keep reading online itchiness and lump or dangerous warning signs. 
I am sorry I am here but this is the only forum that I can discuss this with....please help me.
Posts.Title: please help me I am scared to death!!! i dont know what to do!

Posts.Content: thanks Larry but the lump is inside my breast, deep not on the outside.
Posts.Title: please help me I am scared to death!!! i dont know what to do!

Posts.Content: Not the fibroadenoma in general but the people who are predisposed to getting them are at more of an increased likelihood to get breast cancer?
Posts.Title: Is it true fibroadenomas increase your breast caner risk?

Posts.Content:
BETH! I completely understand what you are going through!!!!
I too have been experiencing an itchy left breast close to the upper side of the areola. It is driving me crazy, I am also getting shooting pain from there and an itchy armpit and like you I fear the worst!!!!
I went to my GYN and he looked at my breasts and did a physical. He found a lump in the same stupid breast!!! IT SCARED THE HECK OUT OF ME. He sent me for a mammo and ultrasound (I didnt do mamo because everyone told me that you are too young and it probably wont show up, etc...) so I did first ultrasound they found nothing.... Because I am an anxious person and I assume no one knows what they are doing I fought to have another ultrasound done with a more experienced tech (the first one who did my ultrasound was 25 yrs old!!) anyway I guess I get lucky cause my husband is a physician at the same hospital, they did it again and they found the lump. THe radiologist was SO confident in telling me it is a fibroadenoma..
I AM STILLL anxious, since I keep reading stories online that masses classified as Fibroadenomas on ultrasound can be cancer on biopsy, so yes they think I am a wack job but I am pressing for a biopsy and want it out.
Back to IBC (inflammatory breast cancer) it scares me so much because nowhere did I read that fibroadenomas cause itchiness like the one I am experiencing. I keep checking my breasts and I really dont see any skin changes but this itch is in one section and my other breast doesnt itch and I keep thinking this is IBC in its early stages but like you I keep getting brushed off since I do not have any noticeable skin changes...
I have an appointment with a Breast Surgeon on Monday and I am going to ask her... I know how you feel it is so frustrating. I am 33 yrs old I have 20 month old daughter but I stopped breast feeding a while ago (over a year) so I know it has nothing to do with that, ,,, I dont even have that as an excuse to comfort me :(((

Posts.Title: Very anxious about breast cancer, please help!

Posts.Content:
After my breast biopsy which was about
 two months ago, they area is still sore and I am getting these zingers, I don't know if its scar tissue or the titanium mark they placed. Also when I bend down I feel like there is something in my breast in that area. I am getting worried. Has anyone experienced this? Will it go away?
Posts.Title: Has anyone experienced this after breast biopsy?

Posts.Content:
I had an ultrasound done on a palpable lump. Turned out to be 8mm. The radiologist was very confident in telling me it was a fibroidadenoma and to come back in 6 months to determine stability. He said if it grows we will biopsy but it is not going to grow (very confident)...
Of course after reading stories online of people who were told they had fibroidadenomas had them biopsied and it turned out to be something else (unlikely I know) but still.. I got freaked out and scheduled a biopsy. Here I am today.
I couldn't sleep the entire night thinking what about
 if that 2 percent is me... anyone had a similar experience?

Posts.Title: Painless lump. Doctor doesn't know what it is.

Posts.Content: Try again. I went to a breast surgeon (hoping to get it biopsied) she agreed to do it for me, and then (after the second sonographer found it on imaging) the breast surgeon with her own machine could not find it. I am now scheduled to have an ultrasound guided biopsy done by a radiologist (I guess he is the most skilled to find the lump), so hopefully I will get this sorted out.
